intro: Hypolytrum goetghebeurii, commonly known as the Cape flatsedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands. Hypolytrum goetghebeurii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
